content: this little diya lamp was designed for my friends mum i stayed with them when i first moved to london and when she realised i was a crafty type she took out lots of beautiful fabric scraps leftovers from sari blouses braids ribbons lace and all kinds of trimmings and asked me to help make decorations for her household shrine this isn t quite such a pretty make as those decorations but i know she appreciates handmade things i d like to share the pattern in case anyone else finds it fun to make it s on my blog 1 for you in both uk and us terms and it s now on youtube 2 too as a video with uk and us captions for the instructions so just use the one you prefer **requirements** * cotton dk yarn in 3 shades i ve used smooth shiny drops muskat in mine as mc along with some unidentified scraps * 20m/yds in main colour mc * 1m/yd in flame contrast colour cc1 * 0 25m/yd in wick contrast colour cc2 i * 3 25mm hook us d-3 or suitable hook to achieve a firm fabric usually a lower size than the yarn band suggestion * yarn needle and scissors **notes** height including flame 5cm 2 circumference 5cm 2 working method the base is worked motif style and the flame and wick added through a picot 1 https //www madewithloveandfibres com/post/festive-diwali-diya 2 https //youtu be/byzsa5p66ca si=egbf2jjqqcpatvt4
